content: 48 rs k5 w&t row 49 ws p4 w&t row 50 rs k15 to end of row row 51 decrease ws *p2tog p2 repeat from * to last 2 sts p2tog 19 sts cut yarn leaving a long tail end thread end through all 19 sts for beak point pull up tightly to close the hole secure gathers by making a stitch or two making up body - with ws together fold bird in half to match row ends and body markers mattress stitch from beak point to body markers stuff bird through the opening at the bottom of the body mattress stitch the opening closed from markers to the top of the tail join tail tip for about 2 5 cm/ 1 in note the rest of the tail curls in on itself so does not need joining beak cut a 60 cm/ 24 in length yarn c thread through sewing needle in a way that you can use yarn doubled secure the yarn at beak point and work straight stitches over and over each other until to have created a triangular beak if you want to create a finer tip on the beak simply dampen the beak a little and mould into a point with your fingers eyes - with black thread/ yarn work french knots for eyes at each side of the head legs - cut two approximate 60 cm/ 24 in lengths yarn c fold each length in half and attach yarn to just above the body markers about 1cm apart so that you can attach the bird to a perch - the yarn acting as claws when you ve tied them around three claws per leg or you can wind the yarn around your finger to make the bird sit on your finger remove body markers abbreviations beg beginning cm centimetre s decrease decrease/decreasing foll following g gram s in inch es increase increase/increasing k knit k2tog knit the next two stitches together kfb knit into the front and back of the same stitch m1 make 1 m metre s mm millimetre s p purl p2tog purl the next two stitches together pfb purl into the front and back of the same stitch pm place marker repeat s repeat s rs right side st st stocking stitch us stockinette stitch st s stitch es ws wrong side w&t wrap & turn take yarn to opposite side of work between the needles slip next stitch purlwise from left hand to right hand needle return yarn to original side of work return slipped stitch to left hand needle without twisting the stitch is now wrapped with yarn turn work and start next row leaving any remaining stitches unworked
